main event: A bright and luminous round object, the size of a basketball, was observed in Westerville, Ohio on 21 August 1956.
interesting points: The object appeared to be stationary at first and faded as it moved across the sky,It was described as a standing ball of light, which diminished in brightness over 10 minutes,The weather conditions were clear during the sighting,The object was still in sight at the time of the report,The investigator noted that there was insufficient data for evaluation, considering possibilities like astronomical or aircraft origins.
sighted object: one round object the size of a basketball, bright and luminous
witness description: insufficient data; details not provided in the report
